Title: Enforcement of expired ex parte orders against Nestoil, Neconde unlawful
Summary: The ex parte orders obtained by FBNQuest Merchant Bank Limited and First Trustees Limited against Nestoil Limited and Neconde Energy Limited are unlawful .

Title: ADC says fresh N1.15tr loan exposes Tinubu’s addiction to reckless debts
Summary: African Democratic Congress (ADC) says fresh N1.15tr loan exposes Tinubu's addiction to reckless debts . Federal Government’s request for a fresh loan of N1 .15 trillion exposes President, says ADC .

Title: JMG donates solar power system to health centre
Summary: JMG Limited has commissioned a solar-powered energy system at the Agboyi-Ketu Primary Health . JMG is an electromechanical solutions provider .

Title: Ponmo consumption threatens $5b leather industry, says FG
Summary: The Federal Government has warned that the continued consumption of hides and skins, popularly known as ponmo, poses a serious threat to the leather industry . The $5b leather industry is estimated to be worth $5 billion .

Title: Anti-Torture Act @ 8: Victims bear scars, endure trauma as law remains on paper
Summary: Anti-Torture Act of 2017 was enacted to end police brutality . Eight years after it was enacted, the law remains largely unenforced . Victims bear scars, endure trauma as law remains on paper .

Title: CAF WC Playoff: DR Congo defeat Cameroon 1-0, to face Nigeria in final
Summary: DR Congo booked their place in the CAF World Cup qualifying play-off final after a narrow 1-0 victory over Cameroon . DR Congo will face Nigeria in the final .

Title: Wike, soldiers altercation: Respect the uniform, no offence committed — Gen. Irabor, Matawalle
Summary: Former Chief of Defence Staff, General Lucky Irabor, retd, and Minister of State for Defence, Bello Matawalle, yesterday warned that any act of disrespect towards the uniformed services amounted to an affront on the authority of the Nigerian state . Title: Genocide: What we discussed with American officials — Amaechi
Summary: Rotimi Amaechi says it was only to press for a free and fair election . There were allegations that the then political opponents of former President Goodluck Jonathan pressured the Americans to ensure that the election was fair .

Title: No religious persecution, genocide in Nigeria — Idris, Tuggar, AU
Summary: Federal Government has rejected claims of Christian genocide in Nigeria . Federal Government described the allegation as false and damaging to the country’s image .

Title: Kalu proposes new outfit to tackle rising insecurity, supports Trump
Summary: Former governor of Abia State and Senator representing Abia North, Orji Uzor Kalu, has called for the creation of a new community-based security outfit to tackle Nigeria's rising insecurity . Kalu supports Trump .
